name: volume-gradient
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Gradient of a volume file.

Computes the gradient of the volume by doing linear regressions for each voxel, considering only its face neighbors unless too few face neighbors exist.  The gradient vector is constructed from the partial derivatives of the resulting linear function, and the magnitude of this vector is the output.  If specified, the volume vector output is arranged with the x, y, and z components from a subvolume as consecutive subvolumes.

inputs.name: presmooth
inputs.description: smooth the volume before computing the gradient

type.name: presmooth
type.description: smooth the volume before computing the gradient

inputs.name: kernel
inputs.description: the size of the gaussian smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

inputs.name: opt_fwhm
inputs.description: kernel size is FWHM, not sigma

inputs.name: opt_roi_roi_volume
inputs.description: select a region of interest to take the gradient of: the region to take the gradient within

inputs.name: vector_volume_out
inputs.description: the vectors as a volume file

inputs.name: opt_subvolume_subvol
inputs.description: select a single subvolume to take the gradient of: the subvolume number or name

output-files.name: vector_volume_out
output-files.description: the vectors as a volume file
